title: Question 19
prompt: What images does the writer use in this sentence to contrast Sula’s relationship with her mother and Sula’s relationship with Nel?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

At the end of this paragraph: “Nel’s call floated up and into the window, pulling her away from dark thoughts back into the bright, hot daylight.”
feedback:
In the last paragraph of this excerpt, Sula is upset at her mother’s words. When she goes upstairs, she is about to cry and has “dark thoughts.” It is when Nel calls up to Sula through the window that Sula moves away from the darkness into the “bright, hot daylight.” Nel is calling her outside, where the two girls enjoy their summer fun. The image of bright, hot daylight represents their friendship, while the image of darkness represents Sula’s relationship with her mother.


“She only heard Hannah’s words, and the pronouncement sent her flying up the stairs. In bewilderment, she stood at the window fingering the curtain edge, aware of a sting in her eye. Nel’s call floated up and into the window, pulling her away from dark thoughts back into the bright, hot daylight.”
